quote: Reach for the stars.
author: Christa McAuliffe

quote: The love that moves the sun and the other stars.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: In the beginning..when ray and day hadn't yet come into existence at all, there was a kind of radiance that illuminates universe. That radiance is the light of knowledge and goodness. That radiance will persistently and consistently shines brightly even after all the stars and moons in this vast universe died out.
author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: We are a way for the cosmos to know itself.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: I have studied the astrological musings of the mystics, and I can conclude one thing: of all things cosmic, bowling is the best.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: Be a star in someone's dark sky.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
author: Chris Bradford,  The Way of the Dragon

quote: Whether you are an astronomer or a life scientist, geophysicist, or a pilot, you've got to be there because you believe you are good in your field, and you can contribute, not because you are going to get a lot of fame or whatever when you get back.
author: Alan Shepard

quote: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me want to dream.
author: Vincent van Gogh,  Van Gogh's Starry Night Notebook

quote: My dear Kepler, what would you say of the learned here, who, replete with the pertinacity of the asp, have steadfastly refused to cast a glance through the telescope? What shall we make of this? Shall we laugh, or shall we cry?
author: Galileo Galilei,  Frammenti e lettere

quote: We are star stuff harvesting sunlight.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Observe the movements of the stars as if you were running their courses with them, and let your mind constantly dwell on the changes of the elements into each other. Such imaginings wash away the filth of life on the ground.
author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

quote: It’s a red sky every night with Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Guide

quote: We are all star stuff.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: The most accessible field in science, from the point of view of language, is astrophysics. What do you call spots on the sun? Sunspots. Regions of space you fall into and you don’t come out of? Black holes. Big red stars? Red giants. So I take my fellow scientists to task. He’ll use his word, and if I understand it, I’ll say, “Oh, does that mean da-da-da-de-da?
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations.
author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quote: where the telescope ends the microscope begins, and who can say which has the wider vision?
author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

quote: Star No matter how bright the star, it's just part of a galaxy which is part of a constellation which is part of the night skywhich is part of the known universewhich is a speck of dust in God's eye.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: We're looking at Earth science, observing our planet. Also space science, looking at the ozone in the atmosphere around our Earth. Also looking at life science. And on a human level, using ourselves as test subjects.
author: Laurel Clark

quote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde,  Lady Windermere's Fan

quote: If you love a flower that lives on a star, it is sweet to look at the sky at night. All the stars are a-bloom with flowers...
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince

quote: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: One planet, one experiment.
author: Edward O. Wilson

quote: Have you ever seen the stars in the night? See them closely, they will tell you, how to be open, how to love and how to shine and twinkle without any differences and jealousy of other stars.
author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

quote: Love looks through a telescope; envy, through a microscope.
author: Josh Billings

quote: You are an aperture through which the universe is looking at and exploring itself.
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: When we look up at night and view the stars, everything we see is shinning because of distant nuclear fusion.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: It is often in the darkest skies that we see the brightest stars.
author: Richard Evans

quote: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Just remember this, my girl, when you look up in the sky you can see the stars and still not see the light.
author: Jack Tempchin

quote: …Our sunsets have been reduced to wavelengths and frequencies. The complexities of the universe have been shredded into mathematical equations. Even our self-worth as human beings has been destroyed.
author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons

quote: I confess I do not know why, but looking at the stars always makes me dream.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: View life through a wide angle lens attitude and see your horizons broaden.
author: Stephen Richards

quote: The Cosmos is all that is or was or ever will be. Our feeblest contemplations of the Cosmos stir us -- there is a tingling in the spine, a catch in the voice, a faint sensation, as if a distant memory, of falling from a height. We know we are approaching the greatest of mysteries.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: Move on, sky is not limit, wind can touch you, water can dip you, mother will care you, wife will nurture you and above all, oneday you will see your child following, up above the sky; you became a star, twinkling, watching and waiting to come back again, on earth.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: Believe and achieve with Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering Connection

quote: Any patch of sunlight in a wood will show you something about the sun which you could never get from reading books on astronomy. These pure and spontaneous pleasures are ‘patches of Godlight’ in the woods of our experience.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: The journey of the sun and moon is predictable, but yours is your ultimate art.
author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: To ask, 'How do you do it?' is already starting off on the wrong foot. When reaching for the stars, there does not have to be a 'how' if there is a big enough 'why'.
author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality

quote: There is no royal road to science, and only those who do not dread the fatiguing climb of its steep paths have a chance of gaining its luminous summits.
author: Karl Marx,  Capital, Vol 1: A Critical Analysis of Capitalist Production

quote: When darkness is at its darkest, a star shines the brightest.
author: Louise Philippe

quote: Students of the heavens are separable into astronomers and astrologers as readily as are the minor domestic ruminants into sheep and goats, but the separation of philosophers into sages and cranks seems to be more sensitive to frames of reference.
author: Willard Van Orman Quine

quote: Only in the darkness can you see the stars.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: I try to show the public that chemistry, biology, physics, astrophysics is life. It is not some separate subject that you have to be pulled into a corner to be taught about.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: A billion stars go spinning through the night, / glittering above your head, / But in you is the presence that will be / when all the stars are dead.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: The stars up there at night are closer than you think.
author: Doug Dillon

quote: What might have been can be with Cosmic Ordering.
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering: You can be successful

quote: And remember this most of all: when it is darkest, that is when you can see the stars most clearly.
author: Kathleen McGowan,  The Poet Prince

quote: In some remote corner of the universe, poured out and glittering among innumerable solar systems, there once was a star on which clever animals invented knowledge.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
